content.title: Intro
content.content: -wen is a Quenya suffix added to names to show feminine derivation, usually as "maiden".[1] Compare -ien. The Sindarin equivalent is gwend, which through lenition becomes -wen too.

content.title: Example
content.content:
Eärwen = "Maiden of the Sea"
Morwen = "Dark maiden"

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, Christopher Tolkien (ed.), The Silmarillion, "Appendix: Elements in Quenya and Sindarin Names", wen
